intro: Acourtia lozanoi, commonly known as the Lozano's acourtia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions.
